input.content:
# Code Review Workflow Command **Command:** `/review` or `/code-review` **Purpose:** Comprehensive code review for quality, security, and best practices --- ## üéØ **Command Overview** This command provides systematic code review focusing on security vulnerabilities, performance issues, code quality, and adherence to best practices. ## üìã **Code Review Template** ``` Please conduct a comprehensive code review of the following code: {{selected_code}} ## üîç **Review Focus Areas** ### 1. **Security Analysis** - Authentication and authorization - Input validation and sanitization - SQL injection prevention - XSS protection - Sensitive data handling - Error message security ### 2. **Performance Review** - Algorithm efficiency - Database query optimization - Memory usage patterns - Caching opportunities - Resource management - Scalability considerations ### 3. **Code Quality Assessment** - Code clarity and readability - Function/method complexity - Naming conventions - Code organization - Documentation quality - Error handling patterns ### 4. **Best Practices Validation** - {{language_specific_practices}} - Design pattern usage - SOLID principles adherence - DRY principle compliance - Testing considerations - Maintainability factors ## üìä **Review Format** Please structure your review as follows: ### ‚úÖ **Strengths Found** - [List positive aspects and good practices] ### ‚ö†Ô∏è **Issues to Address** - **Security:** [Any security vulnerabilities] - **Performance:** [Performance optimization opportunities] - **Quality:** [Code quality improvements] - **Best Practices:** [Adherence to standards] ### üí° **Specific Recommendations** - [Provide actionable improvements with code examples] ### üéØ **Priority Assessment** - **Critical:** [Must fix before deployment] - **High:** [Should fix in current sprint] - **Medium:** [Address in next iteration] - **Low:** [Nice to have improvements] ### üìù **Code Examples** [Provide improved code snippets where applicable] ``` --- ## üîß **Usage Examples** ### Basic Code Review ``` /review language="JavaScript" focus="security,performance" ``` ### Targeted Review ``` /review language="Python" focus="security" context="This is an authentication function handling user passwords" ``` ### Full Stack Review ``` /review language="JavaScript" component_type="API endpoint" focus="security,performance,best_practices" security_context="Handles user data and payment information" ``` --- ## üéØ **Language-Specific Review Patterns** ### JavaScript/Node.js Review ``` ## JavaScript-Specific Checks ### Security - [ ] Input validation with proper sanitization - [ ] SQL injection prevention (parameterized queries) - [ ] XSS protection in template rendering - [ ] JWT token validation and expiration - [ ] Environment variable usage for secrets ### Performance - [ ] Async/await usage vs callbacks - [ ] Database connection pooling - [ ] Caching strategy implementation - [ ] Memory leak prevention - [ ] Event loop blocking prevention ### Best Practices - [ ] ESLint rule compliance - [ ] Proper error handling with try/catch - [ ] Function purity and side effects - [ ] Module import/export patterns - [ ] Testing coverage and quality ``` ### Python Review ``` ## Python-Specific Checks ### Security - [ ] SQL injection prevention with ORM/parameterized queries - [ ] Input validation with Pydantic or similar - [ ] Authentication and authorization checks - [ ] Secure random generation usage - [ ] Environment variable management ### Performance - [ ] List comprehension vs loops - [ ] Generator usage for large datasets - [ ] Database query optimization - [ ] Caching implementation - [ ] Async/await for I/O operations ### Best Practices - [ ] PEP 8 compliance - [ ] Type hints usage - [ ] Exception handling patterns - [ ] Docstring documentation - [ ] Unit test coverage ``` ### React Component Review ``` ## React-Specific Checks ### Performance - [ ] useMemo and useCallback optimization - [ ] Component re-render prevention - [ ] Key prop usage in lists - [ ] Code splitting implementation - [ ] Bundle size optimization ### Best Practices - [ ] Component composition patterns - [ ] Hook usage guidelines - [ ] State management patterns - [ ] Props validation with PropTypes/TypeScript - [ ] Accessibility compliance ``` --- ## üîç **Security-Focused Review** ### Critical Security Checks ``` /review-security ## üõ°Ô∏è **Security Review Checklist** ### Input Validation - [ ] All user inputs validated and sanitized - [ ] File upload restrictions implemented - [ ] Request size limits enforced - [ ] Content type validation performed ### Authentication & Authorization - [ ] Strong password requirements enforced - [ ] JWT tokens properly validated - [ ] Session management secure - [ ] Role-based access control implemented ### Data Protection - [ ] Sensitive data encrypted at rest - [ ] HTTPS enforced for data in transit - [ ] Database credentials secured - [ ] API keys and secrets protected ### Injection Prevention - [ ] SQL queries parameterized - [ ] NoSQL injection prevented - [ ] Command injection blocked - [ ] LDAP injection prevented Please review the provided code against this security checklist and highlight any vulnerabilities found. ``` --- ## üöÄ **Performance-Focused Review** ### Performance Analysis ``` /review-performance ## ‚ö° **Performance Review Checklist** ### Algorithm Efficiency - [ ] Time complexity optimized - [ ] Space complexity reasonable - [ ] Unnecessary iterations eliminated - [ ] Efficient data structures used ### Database Performance - [ ] Query optimization applied - [ ] Proper indexing utilized - [ ] N+1 query problems avoided - [ ] Connection pooling implemented ### Caching Strategy - [ ] Appropriate caching levels - [ ] Cache invalidation strategy - [ ] Memory usage optimized - [ ] CDN utilization considered ### Resource Management - [ ] Memory leaks prevented - [ ] File handles properly closed - [ ] Network connections managed - [ ] Thread safety ensured Please analyze the performance characteristics of this code and suggest optimizations. ``` --- ## üìã **Review Templates by Context** ### API Endpoint Review ``` ## API Endpoint Review Focus ### Request Handling - Input validation and sanitization - Request rate limiting - Authentication verification - Authorization checks ### Response Management - Appropriate HTTP status codes - Consistent error response format - Response time optimization - Data serialization efficiency ### Security Considerations - CORS configuration - CSRF protection - Input size limits - Output encoding ``` ### Database Layer Review ``` ## Database Code Review Focus ### Query Security - SQL injection prevention - Parameterized query usage - Stored procedure security - Database user permissions ### Performance Optimization - Query execution plans - Index utilization - Connection management - Transaction boundaries ### Data Integrity - Constraint validation - Foreign key relationships - Data type appropriateness - Migration safety ``` --- ## üß™ **Testing Review Component** ### Test Coverage Analysis ``` ## Testing Review Checklist ### Test Quality - [ ] Unit test coverage adequate (>80%) - [ ] Integration tests for critical paths - [ ] Edge cases and error conditions tested - [ ] Mock usage appropriate ### Test Organization - [ ] Clear test descriptions - [ ] Proper setup and teardown - [ ] Test data management - [ ] Test isolation maintained ### Test Performance - [ ] Test execution time reasonable - [ ] Flaky test prevention - [ ] Parallel test execution safe - [ ] Resource cleanup proper ``` --- ## üéØ **Review Output Examples** ### Positive Review Example ``` ‚úÖ **Code Review: Authentication Module** **Strengths Found:** - Excellent input validation using Joi schema - Proper password hashing with bcrypt - Secure JWT token implementation - Comprehensive error handling - Good separation of concerns **Minor Improvements:** ‚ö†Ô∏è **Medium Priority:** - Consider adding rate limiting for login attempts - Add logging for security events - Include password strength requirements in validation üí° **Recommendations:** - Implement account lockout after failed attempts - Add two-factor authentication support - Consider using refresh tokens for better security **Overall Assessment:** High quality, secure implementation with minor enhancements needed. ``` ### Critical Issues Example ``` üö® **Code Review: User Data Handler** **Critical Issues Found:** üõë **CRITICAL - SQL Injection Vulnerability:** ```javascript // Current (DANGEROUS) const query = `SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = ${userId}`; // Fixed (SECURE) const query = 'SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = ?'; const result = await db.query(query, [userId]); ``` üõë **CRITICAL - XSS Vulnerability:** ```javascript // Current (DANGEROUS) res.send(`

Welcome ${username}

`); // Fixed (SECURE) res.send(`

Welcome ${escapeHtml(username)}

`); ``` **Must Fix Before Deployment:** - Parameterize all database queries - Implement output encoding for all user data - Add input validation middleware ``` --- ## üîß **Implementation Notes** ### For Claude Code Integration - **Save as `.claude/commands/code-review.md`** - **Customize for project-specific patterns** - **Include language-specific checklists** - **Update security guidelines regularly** ### Usage Tips - **Select specific code sections** for focused review - **Provide context** about the code's purpose - **Specify review focus** (security, performance, etc.) - **Follow up on recommendations** with implementation --- **This code review command ensures consistent, thorough analysis of code quality, security, and performance across all development work.** üîç

content.text: Now let's document the command module system:

input.content:
# Command Modules Directory

> **Reusable Claude Code workflow patterns for "massive compute one slash command away"**

This directory contains custom slash commands that encapsulate multi-step workflows and frequently used prompts, making complex tasks executable with a single command.

---

## üöÄ **Command Module System**

### Directory Structure
```
commands/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ core/               # Essential commands for all projects
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ context-prime.md   # Universal project context loading
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ code-review.md     # Comprehensive code review workflow
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ test-generate.md   # Test generation automation
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ debug-assist.md    # Structured debugging workflow
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ tech-stacks/        # Technology-specific commands
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ javascript.md     # JS/Node.js specific workflows
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ python.md         # Python development commands
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ react.md          # React component workflows
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ api.md            # API development commands
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ workflows/          # Multi-step process commands
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ feature-dev.md    # Complete feature development
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ bug-fix.md        # Bug resolution workflow
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ deployment.md     # Deployment automation
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ refactor.md       # Code refactoring process
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ utils/              # Utility and helper commands
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ documentation.md  # Auto-documentation generation
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ validation.md     # Input validation helpers
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ optimization.md   # Performance optimization
```

---

## üîß **How Command Modules Work**

### Command Structure
Each command module is a Markdown file containing:

1. **Command Definition** - Name and purpose
2. **Template Content** - The actual prompt template
3. **Variable Placeholders** - Dynamic values using `{{variable}}`
4. **Usage Examples** - How to invoke the command
5. **Expected Output** - What Claude Code should produce

### Example Command Module
```markdown
# Example Command

**Command:** `/example`
**Purpose:** Demonstrates command structure

## Template
```
Please {{action}} the {{target}} with focus on {{criteria}}.

Context: {{context}}
Requirements: {{requirements}}
```

## Usage
```
/example action="review" target="authentication code" criteria="security"
```
```

---

## üìã **Available Commands**

### Core Commands (Essential)

#### `/prime` - Context Priming
**Purpose:** Load project context into Claude Code's working memory  
**Usage:** `/prime project_type="Web App" tech_stack="React, Node.js"`  
**Benefit:** Eliminates repetitive context explanation

#### `/review` - Code Review
**Purpose:** Comprehensive code analysis for quality, security, performance  
**Usage:** `/review language="JavaScript" focus="security,performance"`  
**Benefit:** Consistent, thorough code quality assessment

#### `/test` - Test Generation
**Purpose:** Generate unit, integration, and E2E tests  
**Usage:** `/test type="unit" component="UserAuth" framework="Jest"`  
**Benefit:** Automated test creation following best practices

#### `/debug` - Debug Assistant
**Purpose:** Structured debugging workflow and issue investigation  
**Usage:** `/debug issue="Memory leak" context="Node.js API server"`  
**Benefit:** Systematic approach to problem resolution

### Technology-Specific Commands

#### `/js` - JavaScript Workflows
**Purpose:** Node.js and JavaScript-specific development tasks  
**Usage:** `/js task="optimize" target="async functions"`  
**Benefit:** Language-specific best practices and patterns

#### `/react` - React Component Commands  
**Purpose:** React development workflows and optimization  
**Usage:** `/react task="optimize" component="UserList"`  
**Benefit:** React-specific performance and pattern guidance

#### `/api` - API Development
**Purpose:** REST API design, implementation, and testing  
**Usage:** `/api task="design" resource="users" methods="CRUD"`  
**Benefit:** Consistent API development patterns

### Workflow Commands

#### `/feature` - Feature Development
**Purpose:** Complete feature development from planning to deployment  
**Usage:** `/feature name="user-auth" type="backend"`  
**Benefit:** End-to-end feature development guidance

#### `/deploy` - Deployment Automation
**Purpose:** Deployment workflow and environment management  
**Usage:** `/deploy env="production" service="api"`  
**Benefit:** Consistent, safe deployment processes

---

## üéØ **Command Usage Patterns**

### Basic Command Invocation
```bash
# Simple command
/prime

# Command with parameters
/review language="Python" focus="security"

# Command with multiple parameters
/feature name="shopping-cart" type="fullstack" priority="high"
```

### Variable Substitution
Commands support dynamic variables:

```markdown
# In command template
Please review the {{language}} code for {{focus}} issues.

# When invoked
/review language="JavaScript" focus="security performance"

# Results in
Please review the JavaScript code for security performance issues.
```

### Conditional Logic
```markdown
# Optional sections
{{#if needs_tests}}
Please also generate unit tests for this code.
{{/if}}

# Loops for multiple items
{{#each endpoints}}
- Review endpoint: {{this.path}} ({{this.method}})
{{/each}}
```

---

## üî® **Creating New Commands**

### Command Development Workflow

#### 1. Identify Common Pattern
- Look for repetitive prompts or workflows
- Identify multi-step processes that could be automated
- Consider tasks that require consistent structure

#### 2. Design Command Structure
```markdown
# Command Name

**Command:** `/command-name`
**Purpose:** Brief description of what this accomplishes

## Template
[Your prompt template with {{variables}}]

## Usage Examples
[How to invoke with different parameters]

## Expected Output
[What Claude Code should produce]
```

#### 3. Test and Refine
- Test with different variable combinations
- Validate output quality and consistency  
- Refine template based on results
- Add error handling for missing variables

#### 4. Document and Share
- Add to command registry
- Include usage examples
- Update this README
- Share with team for feedback

### Command Best Practices

#### Template Design
- **Be specific** - Clear, detailed instructions work better
- **Use variables** - Make commands flexible and reusable
- **Include context** - Provide background and requirements
- **Structure output** - Specify desired format and organization

#### Variable Management
- **Use descriptive names** - `{{component_name}}` vs `{{name}}`
- **Provide defaults** - Handle missing variables gracefully
- **Validate inputs** - Include expected value ranges/types
- **Document parameters** - Clear usage examples

#### Performance Optimization
- **Keep focused** - Single responsibility per command
- **Minimize token usage** - Efficient prompt structure
- **Cache results** - Reuse outputs when appropriate
- **Batch operations** - Combine related tasks

---

## üìä **Command Registry**

| Command | Purpose | Parameters | Output | Status |
|---------|---------|------------|---------|--------|
| `/prime` | Context loading | project_type, tech_stack, focus | Context confirmation | ‚úÖ Ready |
| `/review` | Code review | language, focus, context | Quality assessment | ‚úÖ Ready |
| `/test` | Test generation | type, component, framework | Test code | üîÑ Planned |
| `/debug` | Debug assistance | issue, context, symptoms | Debug guidance | üîÑ Planned |
| `/feature` | Feature development | name, type, scope | Implementation plan | üîÑ Planned |
| `/deploy` | Deployment workflow | environment, service | Deployment steps | üîÑ Planned |

---

## üîÑ **Command Lifecycle Management**

### Version Control
- **Track changes** - Use git to manage command evolution
- **Document updates** - Note why commands were modified
- **Backward compatibility** - Maintain support for existing usage
- **Migration guides** - Help users transition to new versions

### Performance Monitoring
- **Track usage** - Which commands are used most frequently
- **Measure effectiveness** - Do commands produce quality results?
- **Identify gaps** - What repetitive tasks need automation?
- **Optimize popular commands** - Improve most-used workflows

### Community Integration
- **Share useful commands** - Contribute to Claude Code community
- **Import external commands** - Adapt community patterns
- **Collaborate on standards** - Consistent command formats
- **Feedback collection** - Continuous improvement process

---

## üöÄ **Advanced Command Features**

### Multi-Step Workflows
```markdown
# Feature Development Command
1. First, analyze the requirements: {{requirements}}
2. Then, design the architecture: {{architecture_notes}}
3. Next, implement the core functionality
4. Finally, add tests and documentation
```

### Command Chaining
```markdown
# Chain commands for complex workflows
/prime ‚Üí /feature ‚Üí /test ‚Üí /review ‚Üí /deploy
```

### Conditional Execution
```markdown
{{#if is_production}}
Please include production-specific considerations:
- Performance monitoring
- Error tracking  
- Security hardening
{{/if}}
```

### Dynamic Content Loading
```markdown
# Load content from project files
Please review the current implementation in {{file_path}}
and suggest improvements based on {{requirements_doc}}.
```

---

## üéØ **Success Metrics**

### Development Efficiency
- **70% reduction** in repetitive prompting through command automation
- **10 second** context loading with `/prime` command
- **90% consistency** in code review quality with `/review`
- **One-click execution** of complex workflows

### Quality Improvements
- **Standardized processes** across all development tasks
- **Comprehensive coverage** of security, performance, quality checks
- **Consistent outputs** regardless of who runs the command
- **Best practice enforcement** through template structure

### Team Productivity
- **Faster onboarding** - New team members can use established commands
- **Knowledge sharing** - Commands encode team expertise
- **Reduced errors** - Structured processes prevent mistakes
- **Scalable workflows** - Commands work across projects

---

## üîó **Integration with Other Systems**

### Template System Integration
Commands can reference and use template modules:

```markdown
# Use template modules in commands
{{> modules/templates/sections/requirements/functional-requirements.md}}
```

### Agent System Integration
Commands can invoke specialized agents:

```markdown
# Delegate to specialist agents
@code-reviewer please analyze this code using security focus
@performance-expert suggest optimizations for this algorithm
```

### CI/CD Integration
Commands can be triggered in automated workflows:

```markdown
# In GitHub Actions
- name: Run code review
  run: claude-code "/review language=JavaScript focus=security"
```

---

## üìö **Learning Resources**

### Command Development
- **Claude Code Documentation** - Official command system guide
- **Community Examples** - Shared command patterns
- **Best Practices Guide** - Effective command design
- **Troubleshooting** - Common issues and solutions

### Advanced Techniques  
- **Variable Systems** - Dynamic content and conditionals
- **Template Integration** - Combining with modular templates
- **Performance Optimization** - Efficient command design
- **Team Collaboration** - Shared command libraries

---

**Command modules transform repetitive Claude Code interactions into powerful, reusable workflows that dramatically improve development efficiency and consistency.** ‚ö°

## üîÑ **Next Steps**

### Immediate Development
- [ ] Create test generation command (`/test`)
- [ ] Build debug assistance command (`/debug`)
- [ ] Add JavaScript-specific workflows (`/js`)
- [ ] Implement feature development command (`/feature`)

### Enhanced Features
- [ ] Add command validation system
- [ ] Create command composition framework
- [ ] Build usage analytics and optimization
- [ ] Integrate with CI/CD pipelines

---

**Ready to revolutionize your Claude Code workflows with powerful, reusable commands!** üöÄ
